business.headline: Got an income tax notice? Don't panic, here's how to deal with itFor many honest taxpayers, the unexpected arrival of an income tax notice in their inbox can trigger anxiety. However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

India's AI market to triple by 2027 with strong talent and tech growthThe report, titled "India's AI Leap: BCG Perspective on Emerging Challengers," indicates that the country is set to become one of the fastest-growing AI economies globally.

Paytm shares slide up to 10% after government dismisses MDR rumoursPaytm shares fell sharply in early trade after the government rejected reports suggesting the return of merchant discount rate (MDR) charges on UPI transactions.

Tanla Platforms shares jump 13% today. Check what's driving the rallyTanla Platforms share price: At around 10:10 am, shares of the company were trading 9.96% higher at Rs 684.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

India, EU nearly 90% ready on market access in FTA talks, says Piyush GoyalPiyush Goyal also underlined the political backing behind the deal, referring to the meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in New Delhi on 28 February.
Sensex, Nifty erase early losses to trade in green; IT stocks limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 89.24 points to 82,604.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.45 points to 25,163.80 as of 9:27 am.

Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty likely to open flat. Here's whyAs of 8:34 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,236.5, suggesting that the Nifty 50 index will open close to Wednesday's closing level of 25,141.4.

Stocks to watch on June 12: Wipro, HDFC Bank, IREDA, Nazara Tech, NTPCThe Sensex and Nifty closed higher after a rangebound session on Wednesday. While gains in IT stocks supported the indices, profit booking and the absence of strong triggers limited the overall rise.

Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.
Sensex closes 123 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 123.42 points to end at 82,515.14, while the NSE Nifty gained 37.15 points to close at 25,141.40.

Bharat rising: Why Tier-2 cities drive job growth, explains HireVeda co-founderWhile the metros still lead in the number of jobs, the speed of growth in smaller cities is hard to ignore, noted co-founder of HireVeda and ExecEdge.

India now home to over 85,000 millionaires, ranks 4th globally: ReportIndia now trails only the United States, China, and Japan in terms of the number of wealthy individuals, accounting for 3.7% of the global HNWI population.

entertainment.headline: Telugu actor Kalpika threw plates, body-shamed staff at Hyderabad pub: PoliceTelugu actor Kalpika Ganesh is facing legal action after an incident at Prism Pub in Gachibowli, Hyderabad. The case was registered following complaints of misbehaviour and property damage in a dispute over her birthday celebration.

Ed Sheeran is a fan of Bollywood, Tollywood films: No one makes movies like thatSinger Ed Sheeran confessed that he is a fan of Bollywood and Tollywood films. He replied to a fan and wrote how the aren't any films like them.

Kartik Aaryan declares love for Croatia in new BTS pics from Tu Meri Main Tera setsActor Kartik Aaryan gave a glimpse into the shooting of his upcoming film, 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. Also starring Ananya Panday, the film is being shot in Croatia. He shared the behind-the-scenes photos on his Instagram account.

Alia Bhatt or Alia Kapoor? Fans spot name twist in Alia Bhatt's latest Cannes vlogAlia Bhatt's Cannes vlog sparked buzz after fans spotted a hotel message addressing her as 'Alia Kapoor', hinting at a possible name change post-marriage. While she still uses Bhatt professionally, the moment has stirred speculation online.

Netflix shares first details about Stranger Things animated spin-off, In Your DreamsNetflix shared an update on the animated spin-off of Stranger Things, titled, 'Stranger Things: Tales from '85' at the Annecy Film Festival on Wednesday. The first look of its award-contender 'In Your Dreams' was also shown.

The Summer I Turned Pretty Season 3 trailer: Love, drama, final choices in finaleJenny Han's The Summer I Turned Pretty returns for season 3. The show is set to explore the love triangle one final time at Cousins Beach. Will it be Jeremiah or Conrad? Let's have a closer look at what the trailer features.

Housefull 5 is driven by women: Director on critics calling film sexist'Housefull 5' director Tarun Mansukhani rejected the claims of having a sexist story and misogynist male characters in his film. In an interview, he called the men in the story 'flawed', and shared that women are the ones driving the story.

Diana Penty on Cocktail's re-release: Curious to know what Gen-Z thinks'Cocktail', the popular romantic drama from 2012, has been re-released in theatres across India, rekindling fond memories for many. Actress Diana Penty shared her thoughts on the film's lasting appeal and its reception by younger audiences.

Paresh Rawal steps out in Don't Quit t-shirt amid Hera Pheri 3 exit. PicActor Paresh Rawal's "Don't Quit" t-shirt caught everyone's attention amid news of his exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. Fans are speculating whether it was a subtle message or just a coincidence.

Nikita Roy trailer: Sonakshi, Arjun Rampal confront evil in supernatural thrillerThe trailer of 'Nikita Roy' starring Sonakshi Sinha, Arjun Rampal, and Paresh Rawal is out. The film will release in theatres on June 27.

The worrying form of legendary directors Shankar and Mani RatnamLegendary directors Shankar and Mani Ratnam changed the landscape of Tamil cinema with their creations. However, their recent outings have been marred by harsh criticism, especially because of poor screenwriting.

Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stun at Akhil-Zainab reception. PicsActors Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stole the spotlight at Akhil Akkineni and Zainab Ravdjee's wedding reception in Hyderabad. Pictures from the event show the duo posing with the newlyweds along with their Akkineni family.

Housefull 5 box office Day 6: Akshay Kumar's film races past SikandarAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' has been doing exceptionally well at the box office. The multi-starrer has earned Rs 119.75 crore in six days.

Water tank burst floods Ram Charan-Nikhil's The India House set, many injuredA major accident happened on the sets of Ram Charan's maiden production, 'The India House', starring Nikhil Siddhartha. An assistant cameraperson and many other crew members sustained injuries.

Kajol praises Ajay Devgn's involvement in Maa: He's been a hands-on producerKajol returned to the big screen with 'Maa', a mythological horror co-produced by husband Ajay Devgn. She called him a "hands-on producer" who shaped the film with his keen eye for detail.

Aamir Khan confirms cameo in Rajinikanth's Coolie: Didn't even listen to scriptAamir Khan has finally confirmed his cameo role in Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj's upcoming film, 'Coolie'. The film is gearing up for a grand release on August 14.

Aamir Khan clarifies Mahabharat isn't his final film amid retirement buzzAamir Khan recently put all speculations to rest about his retirement plans. The buzz erupted after the superstar shared his views on the film 'Mahabharat'.

Thug Life box office Day 7: Kamal Haasan's film crashes, Rs 42 crore in Week 1Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' seems to have crashed at the box office. After seven days in theatres, Rs 50 crore-mark still feels distant for the film.

Sabrina Carpenter announces release date of new album 'Man's Best Friend'Sabrina Carpenter announces her bold new album Man's Best Friend, dropping August 29. Featuring chart-topping single Manchild, daring cover art, and a fall tour, the pop star is back with major momentum.

general news.headline: Invite to Pak Army Chief for military parade, General's praise and US's old gamePakistani Army Chief General Asim Munir confirmed his presence at the US military parade in Washington on June 14, sources said. During the trip, he is also expected to meet with officials from the State Department and the Pentagon.

Yunus asked PM Modi to help stop Hasina speeches, got 'can't control it' replyWhen asked whether India was doing what Bangladesh expected, Muhammad Yunus responded without hesitation: "No." He confirmed that Bangladesh had written to the Indian government requesting Hasina's extradition.

Honeymoon murder: How Sonam's mangalsutra, left behind at homestay, helped copsSonam Raghuvanshi left behind her 'mangalsutra' at a Meghalaya homestay, giving police the first clue in the murder of her husband Raja Raghuvanshi during their honeymoon. Five people, including her boyfriend, are now in custody.

Rabindranath Tagore's house attacked in Bangladesh, BJP slams Yunus governmentA mob vandalised the historic Rabindra Kacharibari in Bangladesh's Sirajganj district, which is an ancestral mansion of Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore. The BJP has slammed the Muhammad Yunus government over the incident in which a mob attacked the auditorium on the mansion premises and assaulted its director.

Indian astronaut's launch delayed: The fuel leak dilemma explainedEngineers discovered the leak during a routine seven-second "hot fire" test of the Falcon 9 rocket's booster stage, about 12 hours prior to the launch time.

Clashes, stones thrown in Bengal's Maheshtala over temple vandalism; 40 arrestedViolence broke out in South 24 Parganas, West Bengal, after a Shiva temple was allegedly vandalised over a shop construction dispute. Stones were pelted, vehicles torched, and Section 163 was imposed as police made 40 arrests.

Villa, 19 plots, 3 buildings, cars: Telangana engineer held in anti-corruption raidsAn engineer with Telangana's irrigation department was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau for amassing assets disproportionate to his known income, including multiple apartments and land, across the state. According to sources, he was previously associated with the Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project.
Punjab influencer found dead in car at Bathinda Medical University campusA resident of Ludhiana's Laxman Nagar, Kanchan was quite popular and had over 3 lakh followers on Instagram.

Bhopal bridge with 90-degree turn stumps people, officials defend designA new railway overbridge in Bhopal has stirred controversy due to its sharp 90-degree turn, raising safety concerns among locals. Officials cite land constraints and metro station proximity as reasons for the unusual design.

As US visa woes mount, Indian students now look beyondWith mounting visa hurdles and erratic US policy shifts under the Trump administration, Indian students are seemingly moving away from the American dream even as parents push to prioritise safety and stability. Experts say emotional and financial strain is prompting a shift away from higher education in the US.

Telugu actor Kalpika threw plates, body-shamed staff at Hyderabad pub: PoliceTelugu actor Kalpika Ganesh is facing legal action after an incident at Prism Pub in Gachibowli, Hyderabad. The case was registered following complaints of misbehaviour and property damage in a dispute over her birthday celebration.

Dangerous place: Trump orders US pullback from Middle East amid Iran tensionsThe decision comes against the backdrop of heightened tensions in the Middle East as talks between the US and Iran over its rapidly advancing nuclear program appear to have hit an impasse.

Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stun at Akhil-Zainab reception. PicsActors Sobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya stole the spotlight at Akhil Akkineni and Zainab Ravdjee's wedding reception in Hyderabad. Pictures from the event show the duo posing with the newlyweds along with their Akkineni family.

Most transparent: Poll body chief defends electoral rolls prep amid rigging claimChief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar defended the electoral rolls preparation in India at an event in Sweden, saying it is one of the world's most rigorous and transparent. His statement came amid allegations of fudging voter data and poll rigging by the Opposition, including Congress MP Rahul Gandhi.

Trump Card, offering path to US residency for $5 million, now open for applicantsThe fine print of Donald Trump's social media post suggests that the Gold Card doesn't guarantee anyone US citizenship but is only a 'beautiful road in gaining access to the Greatest Country.' Trump has maintained that he would not need Congress's approval as the 'Gold Card' does not grant citizenship to the buyers, only a path to it.

Water tank burst floods Ram Charan-Nikhil's The India House set, many injuredA major accident happened on the sets of Ram Charan's maiden production, 'The India House', starring Nikhil Siddhartha. An assistant cameraperson and many other crew members sustained injuries.

Got an income tax notice? Don't panic, here's how to deal with itFor many honest taxpayers, the unexpected arrival of an income tax notice in their inbox can trigger anxiety. However, most of them are often routine and manageable. This article explains what these notices really mean, why they're sent, and what you should do if one lands your way.

Perseverance rover captures breathtaking view of Martian moon DeimosPerseverance's camera employed its maximum long-exposure setting of 3.28 seconds for each of 16 individual frames. These were combined onboard into a single composite image.

WTC Final: Timid or outclassed? South Africa's batting on Day 1 sparks debateAUS vs SA, WTC Final: South Africa squandered a strong start in the big final in London as their batters showed a lack of intent, drawing criticism from former players like Matthew Hayden and Dale Steyn. Despite Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul, Australia ended Day 1 on top.

Ashok Gehlot softens tone on Sachin Pilot, says we were never far awayAshok Gehlot made the remark during an interaction with the media at the venue of the 'Prarthna Sabha' held in memory of Rajesh Pilot, a veteran Congress leader and father of Sachin Pilot.

The worrying form of legendary directors Shankar and Mani RatnamLegendary directors Shankar and Mani Ratnam changed the landscape of Tamil cinema with their creations. However, their recent outings have been marred by harsh criticism, especially because of poor screenwriting.

Very nice: Donald Trump responds to Musk's public apology after ugly feudDonald Trump has reacted to Elon Musk's public apology following a week-long online feud. Musk said his comments about the president had "gone too far." Trump told the New York Post he was "really surprised" but held "no hard feelings," though he added he was "a little disappointed."

Amid unrest, Trump deploys more troops to Los Angeles than Syria, Iraq combinedUS President Donald Trump has deployed more troops to Los Angeles to curb protests than the combined number stationed in Iraq and Syria. With around 4,700 personnel on the ground, the move has drawn backlash from California officials.

India, EU nearly 90% ready on market access in FTA talks, says Piyush GoyalPiyush Goyal also underlined the political backing behind the deal, referring to the meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in New Delhi on 28 February.

sports.headline: Gill gets called 'self-obsessed' by fans for having 'Prince' engraving on batStar India batter Shubman Gill is being called 'self-obsessed' by fans for having 'Prince' engraved on his bat. Gill is set to use his new bat in the England series beginning from June 20.

AB de Villiers recalls RCB's painful 18-year wait for IPL trophy in emotional videoLegendary South Africa batter AB de Villiers recalled Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) emotional journey to maiden Indian Premier League (IPL)  triumph in an emotional video.

Webster looked completely ready in WTC Final: Ponting praises all-rounderRicky Ponting praised Beau Webster for his vital knock during Day 1 of the World Test Championship final on Wednesday, June 11. Webster top scored for Australia to power them to 212 runs as he saw them through a rough period.

Start fighting every ball: Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir huddle talk before England TestsIndia coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill inspired the full squad ahead of the England tour with some pep talk. The Indian team is set to embark on a new era under the leadership of Gambhir and Gill in Tests.

Steve Smith goes past Sachin Tendulkar in elite list after gutsy fifty in WTC FinalStar Australia batter Steve Smith went past legendary India batter Sachin Tendulkar in the list of most fifty plus scores in the history of knockout matches of ICC tournaments.

WTC Final: Timid or outclassed? South Africa's batting on Day 1 sparks debateAUS vs SA, WTC Final: South Africa squandered a strong start in the big final in London as their batters showed a lack of intent, drawing criticism from former players like Matthew Hayden and Dale Steyn. Despite Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul, Australia ended Day 1 on top.

Neither Gill nor Nair: Ex-coach suggests new No. 3 options for England TestsSanjay Bangar feels that neither Shubman Gill nor Karun Nair will be playing at No.3 for India during the Test series against England. Bangar feels that it could be a toss-up between two potential debutants for the spot.

Not the ideal start, but still a lot of cricket left to be played: Kagiso RabadaSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada acknowledged that his team hasn't got off to the best of starts with the bat on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. Rabada helped South Africa dismiss Australia for 212, and they later finished the day on 43/4.

Australia are in a good position, despite not getting a big total: Steve SmithStar Australia batter Steve Smith is delighted with his team's position in the WTC Final 2025 against South Africa at the end of Day 1, despite not having enough runs on the board. South Africa are reeling at 43/4 at the end of Day 1 in reply to Australia's first innings score of 212.

Kagiso Rabada acknowledges doping mistake following stellar show in WTC FinalSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada recalled his doping ban following a stellar five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against Australia.

Steve Smith left 'surprised' by South Africa's DRS blunder against Beau WebsterStar Australia batter Steve Smith said he was left surprised by South Africa not opting to go for DRS for a close lbw shout against Beau Webster during Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final at Lord's.

Neither Gill nor Nair: Ex-coach suggests new No. 3 options for England TestsSanjay Bangar feels that neither Shubman Gill nor Karun Nair will be playing at No.3 for India during the Test series against England. Bangar feels that it could be a toss-up between two potential debutants for the spot.

Not the ideal start, but still a lot of cricket left to be played: Kagiso RabadaSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada acknowledged that his team hasn't got off to the best of starts with the bat on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025. Rabada helped South Africa dismiss Australia for 212, and they later finished the day on 43/4.

Australia are in a good position, despite not getting a big total: Steve SmithStar Australia batter Steve Smith is delighted with his team's position in the WTC Final 2025 against South Africa at the end of Day 1, despite not having enough runs on the board. South Africa are reeling at 43/4 at the end of Day 1 in reply to Australia's first innings score of 212.

Kagiso Rabada acknowledges doping mistake following stellar show in WTC FinalSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada recalled his doping ban following a stellar five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final 2025 against Australia.

Steve Smith left 'surprised' by South Africa's DRS blunder against Beau WebsterStar Australia batter Steve Smith said he was left surprised by South Africa not opting to go for DRS for a close lbw shout against Beau Webster during Day 1 of the World Test Championship (WTC) final at Lord's.

Why Manolo Marquez's India stint proves FIFA Career Mode isn't real lifeIndian football tried to play Career Mode in real life—handing one man two jobs, but now it's all gone glitchy. No wins, no goals, no direction. Time to uninstall the experiment.

Nitish Reddy is skillful with ball, want to see him bowl more in Tests: Morne MorkelNitish Kumar Reddy has the knack for delivering "magical" balls, but India's bowling coach Morne Morkel believes the young all-rounder must take on greater bowling responsibility to truly complement his batting prowess.

Sreeja Akula leads Jaipur Patriots to maiden UTT semi-final with 9-6 winUndefeated Sreeja Akula starred as she sealed Jaipur Patriots' maiden UTT semi-final berth with a 9-6 win over PBG Pune Jaguars—her Clarke-like dominance continuing a season of brilliance under the bright lights at Ahmedabad's EKA Arena.

India will come with high hopes, England looking forward to battle: McCullumEngland head coach Brendon McCullum said he is clear about the direction he wants to take his Test side as they brace for a stern challenge from India in what promises to be a demanding summer of cricket.

Australia tough to beat: Beau Webster hails bowlers for WTC Final startBeau Webster's gritty 72 and Australia's fiery bowling fightback, led by Mitchell Starc, flipped the momentum on Day 1 of the WTC Final, as South Africa's top order crumbled under relentless pressure at Lord's.

Australia fight back with pace on 14-wicket Day 1 after Kagiso Rabada specialWTC 2025 final: Australia fought back, picking four South African wickets on a lively Lord's pitch on Day 1. Earlier in the day, Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul helped the first-time finalists dismiss Australia for 212.

BCCI to discuss formulation of norms for IPL celebration after Bengaluru stampedeThe Indian cricket board will discuss the need to formulate norms for victory celebration of Indian Premier League franchises during its apex council meeting on June 14. The matter has gained urgency following the stampede in Bengaluru that killed 11 people and left over 50 injured.

Jasprit Bumrah's energy mind-blowing, in great shape for England Tests: MorkelIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has praised pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah's rhythm and intensity during training sessions in England. The Indian team management plans to manage Bumrah's workload carefully due to his back injury history, aiming for peak fitness in the upcoming Test series.

Australia tough to beat: Beau Webster hails bowlers for WTC Final startBeau Webster's gritty 72 and Australia's fiery bowling fightback, led by Mitchell Starc, flipped the momentum on Day 1 of the WTC Final, as South Africa's top order crumbled under relentless pressure at Lord's.

Australia fight back with pace on 14-wicket Day 1 after Kagiso Rabada specialWTC 2025 final: Australia fought back, picking four South African wickets on a lively Lord's pitch on Day 1. Earlier in the day, Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul helped the first-time finalists dismiss Australia for 212.

BCCI to discuss formulation of norms for IPL celebration after Bengaluru stampedeThe Indian cricket board will discuss the need to formulate norms for victory celebration of Indian Premier League franchises during its apex council meeting on June 14. The matter has gained urgency following the stampede in Bengaluru that killed 11 people and left over 50 injured.

Jasprit Bumrah's energy mind-blowing, in great shape for England Tests: MorkelIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has praised pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah's rhythm and intensity during training sessions in England. The Indian team management plans to manage Bumrah's workload carefully due to his back injury history, aiming for peak fitness in the upcoming Test series.

Sad Virat Kohli retired like this, I'd have made him Test captain again: ShastriFormer India captain Ravi Shastri said Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket could have been handled better by the stakeholders of Indian cricket. Kohli ended his Test career on May 12, a month before India's tour of England.

Five-star Kagiso Rabada goes past Allan Donald, rattles Australia at Lord'sWorld Test Championship 2025 final: South Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada took a five-wicket haul as Australia were bundled out for 212 on Day 1 of the big final. Rabada was well supported by left-arm pacer Marco Jansen at Lord's, London.

Mumbai Indians star Tilak Varma to get red-ball exposure in County ChampionshipTilak Varma will play in England's County Championship for Hampshire this summer. The Mumbai Indians star will reportedly play four first-class games in England.

WTC Final: Steve Smith goes past Gary Sobers to script Test record at Lord'sSteve Smith became the visiting batter to score the most runs in Tests at Lord's on Wednesday when he reached 51 runs on Day 1 of the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

Video: Kyle Verreynne takes stunning one-handed catch to dismiss Travis HeadSouth Africa dominated the morning session of the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's. Wicketkeeper Kyle Verreynne took a sensational catch to deny Travis Head a counterpunch on Day 1 in London.

Suryakumar Yadav drops to sixth, Adil Rashid roars to no. 2India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has slipped out of the top five in the latest ICC Men's T20I Rankings for batters. On the other hand, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid has climbed to No. 2 in the bowling rankings.

Watch: D Gukesh picks his favourite meme on viral Magnus Carles outburstD Gukesh couldn't stop laughing as he reacted to hilarious viral memes about Magnus Carlsen's dramatic table slam — even picking his personal favourites in a ChessBase India interview that delighted fans online.

How to manage Bumrah's workload in England? Ganguly gives key adviceSourav Ganguly warned the Indian team from overworking Jasprit Bumrah and advised them to limit his workload during the England tour. Bumrah carried the bulk of the load during the Australia tour, which forced him out of action due to a back issue.

ICC Chairman Jay Shah rings Lord's bell to kick off ultimate Test battleICC chairman Jay Shah rang the iconic Lord's bell to mark the start of the World Test Championship final. South Africa seized early advantage, bowling first, putting Australia under pressure on day one.

Dressing room seems like a funeral, but India can still qualify: Coach MarquezIndian football head coach Manolo Marquez described the mood in the dressing room as "a funeral" after his side's crushing last-minute 0-1 defeat to Hong Kong in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers.

Carlo Ancelotti ready to look forward as Brazil qualify for World CupCarlo Ancelotti said that he is ready to look forward as Brazil qualified for the FIFA World Cup 2026 with a 1-0 win over Paraguay. Ancelotti secured his first win as the manager of the Brazilian national team.

Carlos Alcaraz unwinds in Ibiza amid doubts over Wimbledon tune-up participationCarlos Alcaraz headed Ibiza for a much-needed break after his French Open victory. His upcoming participation at Queen's Club, an ATP 500 tournament in London, remains uncertain.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
